Authors:
Chiung-Chih Chang, Chi-Yu Chen, Wen-Wen Lin, Hsiao-Wei
Kao
Title:
Mycena venus, Mycena luguensis, and Mycena jingyinga, three
new species of bioluminescent mushrooms in Taiwan
Abstract:
Three new species of bioluminescent mushrooms, Mycena
venus, M. luguensis, and M. jingyinga, were proposed based on
phylogenetic and morphological analyses. The three new species are
characterized by small to medium size, white or brown, adnate to
subdecurrent lamellae, pubescentstips with fibrils at bases, four-spore
basidia, amyloid spore, numerous cheilocystidia with various shapes and
pileipellis with short, simple or diverticulate excrescences. These
characteristics are congruent to those of Mycena section Fragilipedes.
Phylogenetic tree showed that M. venus, M. luguensis, and M. jingyinga
had the closest relationships to M. plumbea, M. haematopus, and M.
abrambii, respectively. The details of morphological and phylogenetic
differences among the three new species and the other similar species
are discussed. The three new species bring the total of bioluminescent
mushrooms to 96 and 15 species in the world and Taiwan,
respectively.
